segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring onto the floor, forming a puddle right under her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to notice, just keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just ignoring it or really doesn’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, and she’s clueless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for cookies like he’s about to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her share, like this is totally normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside the window while chaos unfolds inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast is almost funny if it weren’t so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone should really do something before this ends badly.
segments.speaker: PAR
